column4: how much of a hit in performance do you get when running ubuntu 'inside windows' (fat32) ?
also is there a way to install ubuntu without burning it to a physical cd ?
a way to install  Linux 'inside' windows
vs. running ubuntu under windows in virtualbox/vmware
and yes you can make bootable/installable thumbdrives
when i pop in the ubuntu cd it gives me the option to 'install inside windows' which i asume just installs it in fat32
incorrect.. has nothing to do with 'in fat32;
it makes a large file.. and installs to 'that' and then sets the boot option  to boot from that file  via WUBI.
ok i just assumed that was the case since they make a point of saying that performance is going to take a hit
it does.. and i dont suggest using wubi at all
i use 'unetbootin' and a ubuntu.iso file to make a bootable thumbdrive
or boot the live cd. and use the ubuntu Usb-drive tool to make a bootablew thmbdrive with peristant HOME save space
problem is i cant burn the live cd to begin with; otherwise i'd just install it from there
ive done it via virtualbox. :) but its an annoyance.. dident need to burn either.. I would just use unetbootin. if you just want to Install from usb
